turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: We're getting a stretch limo.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Your mom must be really glad you're not taking me.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: You're mad. Why are you mad?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm not mad. I'm in a fucking great mood. Despite the fact that I'm trapped in a fat suit I can't take off, despite the fact that everyone is making fun of me behind my back, despite the fact that your little girlfriend gave me the stinkeye in art class yesterday...

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Katrina's not my girlfriend! And I doubt she was actually giving you the stinkeye. She just looks like that all the time.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: You're being really immature.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That's not how our thing works! I hurl the accusations and you talk me down, remember?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Not this time. You don't have any reason to be mad at me. You broke my heart. I should be royally ticked at you, man. I should be really cheesed off. I shouldn't want to talk to you anymore.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Why? Because I got bored and had sex with you one day, and then I didn't, like, marry you?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Like I'd marry you! You would be the meanest wife of all time. And anyway, I know you weren't bored that day because there was a lot of stuff on TV. The Blair Witch Project was on Starz, and you were like, "Oh, I want to watch this, but we should make out instead. La la la."

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Forget it, Bleek. Take Katrina the Douche Packer to the prom. I'm sure you guys will have a really bitchin' time!

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Yeah, well... I still have your underwear.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I still have your virginity!

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Oh my God, SHUT UP!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What? Are you ashamed that we did it?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well at least you don't have to walk around with the evidence under your sweater. I'm a planet!

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Wait, let me take that.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: You shouldn't be carrying that heavy bag. I'll take it.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh. It's fine. What's another ten pounds?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Did you put like a hundred things of Tic Tacs in my mailbox?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah. That was me.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Because they're your fave. And you can never have too much of your favorite one-calorie breath mint.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Well... thanks. I think I'm pretty much set until college on the Tic Tac front.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You know, I've been thinking. I'm really sorry I was such a huge bitch to you. You didn't deserve that. You never deserve any of the poo I unload on you.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: You know it's okay.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Also, I think I'm in love with you.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: What, you mean as friends?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, for real. I think you are the coolest person I've ever met. And you don't even have to try.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I try really hard, actually...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, you're naturally smart. You always think of the funniest things to do. Remember when you passed me that postcard during Spanish class, and it was addressed like, "Junebug MacGuff, Row 4, Third Seat From the Blackboard"? And it said, "I'm having fun in Barcelona -- wish you were here"? That was hilarious.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I was just bored. I only think school is awesome like, 80% of the time.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Plus, you're the only person who doesn't stare at my stomach all the fucking time. You actually look at my face. And every time I look at you, the baby starts kicking me super hard.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: It does?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Wizard!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I think it's because my heart starts pounding when I see you.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Mine too.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Basically, I'm completely smitten with you, and I don't care if I'm making an ass out of myself right now, because you've seen me make an ass out of myself a million times, and you still want to be my friend.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Well, yeah. You're the best friend I've ever had, even when you're being kind of evil.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That's all I need from you. That's more than I could ever ask for. You're just golden, dude.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Can we make out now?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: You're a part time lover and a fulltime friend. The monkey on your back is the latest trend. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Here is the church and here is the steeple. We sure are cute for two ugly people. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: We both have shiny happy fits of rage. You want more fans, I want more stage. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You are always trying to keep it real. I'm in love with how you feel. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I kiss you on the brain in the shadow of a train. I kiss you all starryeyed, my body's swinging from side to side. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The pebbles forgive me, the trees forgive me. So why can't you forgive me? I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.

turns.speaker: VIJAY
turns.text: Hey man.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Oh, hey Vijay.

turns.speaker: VIJAY
turns.text: Did you hear Juno MacGuff is pregnant?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: VIJAY
turns.text: Just like our moms and teachers!

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: VIJAY
turns.text: Did you hear it's yours?

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: VIJAY
turns.text: What a trip, man.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I don't really know anything about it.

turns.speaker: VIJAY
turns.text: You should grow a moustache. You're a real man now.

turns.speaker: BLEEKER
turns.text: I can't grow a moustache. It never comes in evenly.

turns.speaker: VIJAY
turns.text: Me neither. But I'm going to stop wearing underpants in order to raise my sperm count. See you.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: What? I'm not made of stone.

turns.speaker: ULTRASOUND TECH
turns.text: Well, there we have it. Would you like to know the sex?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Wait, what's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: ULTRASOUND TECH
turns.text: I just see a lot of teenage mothers come through here. It's obviously a poisonous environment for a baby to be raised in.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: They could be utterly negligent. Maybe they'll do a far shittier job of raising a kid than my dumbass stepdaughter ever would. Have you considered that?

turns.speaker: ULTRASOUND TECH
turns.text: No... I guess not.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: What is your job title, exactly?

turns.speaker: ULTRASOUND TECH
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: I said, what-is-your-job-title, Missy?

turns.speaker: ULTRASOUND TECH
turns.text: I'm an ultrasound technician, ma'am.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Well I'm a nail technician, and I think we both ought to stick to what we know.

turns.speaker: ULTRASOUND TECH
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: You think you're special because you get to play Picture Pages up there?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Nails? Really?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: No, I mean the father! Who's the father, Juno?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Just tell it to me straight, Bren. Do you think this is my fault? Her mother's fault?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: I think kids get bored and have intercourse. And I think Junebug was a dummy about it. But we have to move on from here and help her figure it out.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'm not ready to be a Pop-Pop.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: You're not going to be a Pop-Pop. And Juno's not going to be a ma. Somebody else is going to find a precious blessing from Jesus in this garbage dump of a situation. I friggin' hope.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Did you see it coming when she sat us down here?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Oh God yeah. But I was hoping she was expelled or into hard drugs.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That was my first instinct too. Or D.W.I. Anything but this. And I'm going to punch that Bleeker kid in the weiner the next time I see him.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Oh Mac, no! He's a sweet kid. You know it wasn't his idea.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Juno? Did you happen to barf in my urn? Mac, you know that nice urn by the front door, the one I got up in Stillwater? I found some weird blue shit, I mean stuff, gunk, in there this morning.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I would never barf in your urn, Brenda. Maybe L.B. did it.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I have no idea how to spit this out.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Hon, did you get expelled?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No. The school would probably contact you in the event of my expulsion.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Well, I was just asking. It seemed plausible.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Oh, God...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: But I'm going to give it up for adoption. I already found the perfect people.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: But they have a real lawyer and everything. I'm going to meet with them next weekend.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Junebug, that is a tough, tough thing to do. Probably tougher than you can understand right now.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well, I'm not ready to be a mom.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Well, you're a brave young lady. You're made of stronger stuff than I thought. You're a little Viking!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Cool it.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: First things first, we have to get you healthy. You need prenatal vitamins. Incidentally, they'll do incredible things for your nails, so that's a plus. Oh, and we need to schedule a doctor's appointment. Find out where you're going to deliver.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The term "deliver" is so weird. Can we not say "deliver"?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Where the hell have you been, Junebug?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I drove to St. Cloud to show Mark and Vanessa the ultrasound. And I wound up staying for a couple of hours.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: A couple of hours? Why are you going up there in the first place?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: They said they wanted to know about this stuff. They said to keep them updated, so I did!

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: You could have sent it to them. Why would you drive an hour out to East Jesus, Nowhere?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I don't know, I just did. And while we were waiting for Vanessa, Mark and I watched The Wizard of Gore and he burned me some CDs of weird music. He's kind of cool.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: That was a mistake, Juno. Mark is a married stranger. You overstepped a boundary.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Listen, Bren-duhhh, I think you're the one overstepping boundaries. You're acting like you're the one who has to go through this and get huge and push a baby out of your vag for someone else. Besides, who cares if he's married? I can have friends who are married.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: It doesn't work that way, kiddo. You don't know squat about the dynamics of marriage.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You don't know anything about me!

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: I know enough.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: We don't even have a dog!

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Yeah, because you're allergic to their saliva. I've made a lot of sacrifices for you, Juno. And in a couple years you're going to move out -- and I'm getting Weimaraners.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Wow, dream big!

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Oh, go fly a kite.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Ow, ow, fuckity-ow. Bren, when do I get that Spinal Tap thing?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: It's called a spinal block, and you can't have it yet, honey. The doctor said you're not dilated enough.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You mean I have to wait for it to get even worse? Why can't they just give it to me now?

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Well, honey, doctors are sadists who like to play God and watch lesser people scream.

turns.speaker: BREN
turns.text: Shit.  Hey, can we give my kid the damn spinal tap already?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: It really didn't hurt that bad having him.

turns.speaker: GERTA
turns.text: So, Juno. First off, how far along are you?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm a junior.

turns.speaker: GERTA
turns.text: No, I mean in your pregnancy.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh. Uh, my stepmom took me to the doctor yesterday and they said I was twelve weeks.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah! The way people used to do it. Quick and dirty, like ripping off a Band-Aid.

turns.speaker: GERTA
turns.text: Well, then we agree a traditional closed adoption would be best for all involved, then?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Shit, yeah. Close it up.

turns.speaker: GUY LAB PARTNER
turns.text: Amanda, I told you to go to the infirmary and lie down. You never listen.

turns.speaker: GIRL LAB PARTNER
turns.text: No Josh, I don't take orders. Not from you and not from any man.

turns.speaker: GUY LAB PARTNER
turns.text: You know, you've been acting like this ever since I went up to see my brother at Mankato. I told you, nothing happened!

turns.speaker: GIRL LAB PARTNER
turns.text: Something happened. Because your eyes? Are very cold? They're very cold, Josh. They're cold, lying eyes.

turns.speaker: GUY LAB PARTNER
turns.text: What? My eyes are not lying!

turns.speaker: GIRL LAB PARTNER
turns.text: Yes they are, Josh. Since Mankato, they have been lying eyes.

turns.speaker: GUY LAB PARTNER
turns.text: Good. Call me when you're OFF the rag.

turns.speaker: GIRL LAB PARTNER
turns.text: Fine. Call me when you learn how to love just one person and not cheat at your brother's college just because you had four Smirnoff Ices and a bottle of Snow Peak Peach flavored Boone's!

turns.speaker: GUY LAB PARTNER
turns.text: Good, I'll be sure to do that, Amanda. I'll make a note of it.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: This is our attorney, Gerta Rauss.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Geeeerta Rauuuss!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Cool. Well, let's sit down and get to know each other a bit.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: So, let's discuss how we're gonna do this... thing.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well, I just have the baby and give it to you, right?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Whoah. I don't want to see pictures. I don't need to be notified of anything. Can't we just kick it old school? I could just put the baby in a basket and send it your way. You know, like Moses in the reeds.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Technically, that would be kickin' it Old Testament.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Whoops! Yikes, I didn't expect to see you up here.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Sorry. I was just getting something.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Did your wife send you up here to spy on me?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: What? No! Do we come off like paranoid yuppies or something?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well, you don't just invite a random pregnant teenager into your house and leave her unsupervised. I could be a total klepto, for all you know.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I don't get a klepto vibe from you. Evil genius? Maybe. Arsonist? Wouldn't rule it out.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I did steal a squirt of perfume. What do you think? It's Clinique Happy.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Am I supposed to feel happy now?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You should be happy, Holmes. I'm giving you and Vanessa the gift of life. Sweet, screaming, pooping life! And you don't even have to be there when the baby comes out of me all covered in...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Viscera?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Blood and guts.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: We'd better get back downstairs ASAP.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh. That's, uh, my room. Vanessa lets me have a room for all my old stuff.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Wow, you get a whole room in your own house? She's got you on a long leash there, Mark.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: It's beautiful. I've always liked Gibson better than Fender.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: What do you play?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I rock a Harmony.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What? I'm a pawn shop rocker.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Sorry. I swear I'm not a gear snob.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What is that, Mahogany? What happens if you crack the neck?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Tell me about it. I used to play in a really tight band back when I lived in Chicago, and one night we opened for the Melvins... do you know who the Melvins are?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Well, we were playing with them and I busted this guitar onstage. It cost me $800 and a dime bag just to have it fixed.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: When was this, like '96?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: '93. I'm telling you that was the best time for rock and roll.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Nuh-uh, 1977! Punk Volume 1. You weren't there, so you can't understand the magic.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You weren't even alive!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Your guitar is named Kimber?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That's all right. My axe is named Roosevelt. After Franklin, not Ted. Franklin was the hot one with the polio.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Juno? Wow, I didn't expect to see you here.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I've got something really cool to show you guys. Is Vanessa here?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: No, she's working late tonight. She's trying to accrue some extra time off for when, you know...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Right. I hear they can be kind of a time-suck.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Come on in. You wanna Ginseng Cooler?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Sure. What is it with you rich people and your herb-infused juices?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I don't know. Something to do with the four-packs...  ...They're not bad.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Why aren't you at work?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I mostly work from home. I'm a composer.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No shit. Like Johannes Brahms?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: No, more commercial stuff.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Commercials.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Have you seen those ads for Titanium Power men's deodorant?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Titanium Power! Get more snatch by the batch!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I wrote that.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You're kind of a sellout, aren't you? What would the Melvins say?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: They'd say you came a long way out here not knowing if anyone would be home.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Behold, good sir! The very first photo of your future child.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You're kidding!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I think it kind of looks like my friend, Paulie.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh, is he bald and amorphous?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, he's the dad.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Can you tell if it's a boy or a girl?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The doctor can tell, but I decided not to know. I want it to be a big surprise.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Well, it can really only go two ways.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That's what you think. I drink tons of booze so you might get one of those scary neuter-babies that's born without junk.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Junk?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You know... it's parts...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I know what junk is.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: We definitely want it to have junk.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well don't worry about it. My stepmom is forcing me to eat really healthy. She won't even let me stand in front of the microwave or eat red M&Ms. Hope you're ready.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: It's only my favorite song. It's Sonic Youth doing "Superstar" by the Carpenters.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I've heard the Carpenters before. Chick drummer and freaky dude. Not unlike the White Stripes.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You haven't heard the Carpenters like this. Listen.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Don't you remember you told me you loved me, baby...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hey, I like this.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: This album is all Carpenters covers by alt-rock bands. It's called If I Were a Carpenter. It is God. I'll rip a copy for you before you leave.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You don't have to do that.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: It's the least I can do. What did you say your favorite band was?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I didn't. But it's a three-way tie between the Stooges, Patti Smith and the Runaways.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah, I definitely need to make you some CDs. At least while my kid is hanging out in there.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The Wizard of Gore?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh yeah. It's Herschel Gordon Lewis. He's the ultimate master of horror.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Please. Dario Argento is the ultimate master of horror.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Argento's good, but Lewis is completely demented. We're talking buckets of goo. Red corn syrup everywhere. And fake brains up the yin-yang.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Frankly, this looks kind of stupid.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: This is even better than Suspiria. You've got decent taste in slasher movies, Mark.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Here's to dovetailing interests.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: So, have you and Vanessa thought of a name for the baby yet?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Well, sort of. Vanessa likes Madison for a girl.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Madison? Isn't that kind of... I don't know, gay?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: God, pretentious much? I guess everyone should have a mysterious name like Juno, huh?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: My dad went through this phase where he was obsessed with Greek and Roman mythology. He named me after Zeus's wife. I mean, Zeus had other lays, but I'm pretty sure Juno was his only wife. She was supposed to be really beautiful but really mean. Like Diana Ross.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: That suits you.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Uh, thanks.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You know, not many teenage girls in your situation would actually go through with this.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I weighed my options. But after all this, I'm glad I didn't, you know, get rid of it. I want to have it. For you guys.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You're something else.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Vanessa. Shit, you better get out of here.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Why? What the big deal?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Nothing. She just hates when I sit around watching movies and 'not contributing.'

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'll handle this. I'm really good at diffusing mom-type rage.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Juno was nice enough to bring this by for us.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I came over as soon as I got that cold ultrasound goo off my pelvis. My stepmom verbally abused the ultrasound tech so we were escorted off the premises.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hey, what kind of swag did you score?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah. Mall madness, huh?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I doubt anyone's throwing us a shower.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Cold feet.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You should have gone to China. I heard they give away babies like free iPods. They shoot 'em out of those T-shirt guns at sports events.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: So, I've been spending a lot of time listening to that weird CD you made me.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh really? What's the verdict?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I sort of like it. I mean, it's cute.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Cute?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well, when you're used to the raw power of Iggy and the Stooges, everything else sounds kind of precious by comparison.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I imagine you have a collection of punk chestnuts to prove your point.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Consider it your musical education.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I'm dying to see what you've got to teach me.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Okay, stop surfing porn and get back to work. Just wanted to say hi.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Go learn something.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Wow. That shirt is working hard.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Is Vanessa here?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Nope. We're safe.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Come on, I have something for you.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh, Mark! Is this the baby's room? It's beautiful!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Hilarious. No, I just keep all of my old comics down here, and I want to show you one of them.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh God, you're one of those guys...

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You're gonna like this, I promise.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: "Most Fruitful Yuki"? What is... Oh my god, she's a pregnant superhero!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Isn't that great? I got it when I was in Japan with my band. She reminds me of you.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Wow, I actually feel like less of a fat dork now.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Most Fruitful Yuki is bad ass, man. You should be proud to be the same condition.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I actually know this one.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah, this song's older than me, if you can believe that. I danced to it at my senior prom.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: That's almost interesting, Mark. Who did you dance with?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Her name was Cynthia Vogel and she was a good dance partner. Even let me put my hands on her butt.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh man, I can just picture you slow dancing like a dork!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh, okay. Like this.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: You've never been to a dance, have you?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Only squares and nerds go to dances.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: What are you?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I'm leaving Vanessa.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: It's just not working out, but I'm getting my own place in the city... and I've got it all planned out. It's something I've wanted to do for a long time...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No. No, you definitely cannot do that, Mark. That's a big, fat sack of no!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: This isn't what we agreed on. You guys have to take care of... this! You are the chosen custodians of the big-ass bump!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: But I thought you'd be cool if...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I want you guys to adopt the Buglet. I wanted everything to be perfect. Not shitty and broken like everyone else's family. Listen, once I have the baby, Vanessa is going to finally be happy, and everything will be all right. Believe me on this one!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: A baby is not going to fix everything. Besides, I don't know if I'm ready to be a father.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: But you're old!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: I... How do you think of me, Juno? Why are you here?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I don't know. I just liked being your friend. I sort of liked becoming furniture in your weird life.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: This...  ...this is what my life has become. Stuff in boxes. Stuff underground. Is that so appealing to you?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, I guess... Is this my fault? Is Vanessa mad at you because of me?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: That's not the point. We're just not in love anymore.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, but didn't you love Vanessa when you married her? If you love someone once, you can love them again, I know it. My friend Leah has gone out with the same guy, like, four times. You're just not trying.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Please don't get a divorce! God, Mark, just do me a solid and stay with your wife.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: God, you're so young.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Not really. I'm sixteen. I'm old enough to tell when people are acting like total a-holes!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Uh, hi Su-Chin.

turns.speaker: SU-CHIN
turns.text: Oh, hi Juno. How are you?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Good. I'm good.  Did you finish that paper for Worth's class yet?

turns.speaker: SU-CHIN
turns.text: No, not yet. I tried to work on it a little last night, but I'm having trouble concentrating.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: You should try Adderall.

turns.speaker: SU-CHIN
turns.text: No thanks. I'm off pills.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Wise move. I know this girl who had a huge crazy freakout because she took too many behavioral meds at once. She took off her clothes and jumped into the fountain at Ridgedale Mall and she was like, "Blaaaaah! I'm a kraken from the sea!"

turns.speaker: SU-CHIN
turns.text: I heard that was you.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well, it was nice seeing you.

turns.speaker: SU-CHIN
turns.text: Juno! Your baby probably has a beating heart, you know. It can feel pain. And it has fingernails.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Really? Fingernails?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Hi! I'm Vanessa. You must be Juno and Mr. MacGuff. I'm Vanessa.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Vanessa, right?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Can I take your coats?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Wicked pic in the Penny Saver, by the way. Super classy. Not like those other people with the fake woods in the background. Like I'm really going to fall for that, you know?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: You found us in the Penny Saver?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I'll get drinks. What would everyone like? I've got Pellegrino, Vitamin Water...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: A Maker's Mark, please. Up.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh, that's marvelous. So you're almost into your second trimester, then?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, apparently. I'm having it on May 4.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: The tough part's almost over for you. I mean, my girlfriends always tell me the first couple months are the hardest.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, but I hardly noticed it. I'm more worried about the part where I have to start wearing jeans with an elastic panel in the front.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: I think pregnancy is beautiful.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well, you're lucky it's not you.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Well, shall we start looking over the paperwork? Gerta has already drafted some preliminary documents.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Can I use the facilities first? Being pregnant makes you pee like Seabiscuit.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Sure. The powder room down here is being re-tiled, but you can use the master bath upstairs. Go up, then turn left and on your right...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Room with a toilet, got it.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Oh. Sure. Of course you'd want to know how your kid is cooking.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: So, then, you really think you're going to go ahead with this?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm going to say I'm 104% sure.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh really?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Look, if I could give it to you now, I would. But it probably looks like a Sea Monkey at this point, so I think we should leave it in there for a while until it gets cuter, you know?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Juno! God, you startled me. What are you doing here? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Nothing...

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Then what's going on?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I went to the doctor today.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Is the baby okay?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Sure. It's the right size and everything. I even saw its phalanges today! Check this...

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: What...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: This is the baby. Your baby.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh my God...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Doesn't it look like it's waving? It's kind of like it's saying "Hi, Vanessa. Will you be my mommy?"

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah, it kind of does.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh it's just some stuff I picked up. For, you know, the baby. Babies need a lot of things. I want everything to be just right.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I thought people got all that stuff at baby showers. When my stepmom had my sister I remember she got about a million presents. They were all lame though, so I wasn't jealous.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Um, I think people are kind of unsure about the situation because it's not, you know, set in stone.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What do you mean? You mean...  Do you think I'm going to flake out on you?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: No, no, I don't think that, Juno. It's just that, we went through a situation before where it didn't work out.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Right. Well, Juno, your parents must be wondering where you are. You might want to head home.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Naah. I'm already pregnant, so they figure nothing worse could happen to me. I gotta bounce anyway. It was nice seeing you guys again.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Well hi Vanessa! What brings you to the mall today?

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Just, you know, shopping with my girlfriends.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Please excuse Leah. She's mentally challenged.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh, okay. So... how are you feeling?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Happy? Oh, you mean like, physically. I'm good. Look, I have a snooze button now!

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Um... Juno, can I -- Can I touch it?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Are you kidding? Everyone at school is always grabbing at my belly. I'm like a legend. They call me the Cautionary Whale.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Oh my God -- It moved! I felt it!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Elbow.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Wow! It's magical.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Juno? What's going on?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: VANESSA
turns.text: Mark? Why is Juno crying?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm not crying. I'm allergic to fine home furnishings. See you later.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hi. I'm here for the big show?

turns.speaker: PUNK RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Your name, please?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Juno MacGuff.

turns.speaker: PUNK RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Would you like some free condoms? They're boysenberry.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No thank you. I'm off sex.

turns.speaker: PUNK RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: My partner uses these every time we have intercourse. They make his balls smell like pie.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Congrats.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You should have seen this octopus furnace. I had to get out my Hazmat suit just to get up in there...

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: My dad used to be in the Army, but now he's just your average HVAC specialist. He and my mom got divorced when I was five. She lives on a Havasu reservation in Arizona...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: So Juno, how did your maneuver go last night?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Which maneuver, sir? The one in which I moved an entire living room set from one lawn to another, or the one in which I cleared a sixty-four ounce blue slushie in ten minutes?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Do you need a large sum of money? Legal counsel?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, no, I'm definitely not asking for anything. Except maybe mercy. Like, it would be really great if nobody hit me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What have you done, Junebug? Did you hit someone with the Previa?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: They say they're going to pay my medical expenses and everything. I promise this will all be resolved in thirty-odd weeks, and we can pretend it never happened.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You're pregnant?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: I'm so sorry, you guys. If it's any consolation, I have heartburn that's like, radiating down to my kneecaps and I haven't gone number two since Wednesday. Morning!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Who is the kid?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: The baby? I don't know anything about it yet. I only know it's got fingernails, allegedly.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Paulie Bleeker? I didn't know he had it in him!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Okay, this is no laughing matter.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, it's not. Paulie is virile, by the way. He was very good in... chair.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Did you say you were thinking about adoption?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Yeah, well, there's this couple who've been trying to have a baby for five years.
